column5: Dad and i flew out of sioux lookout to root bay on lake st jo of sept 27,got picked up oct 5.Water was way low and fishing was tough at times till we found a pattern that worked.Best depth was 20-30 ft with a 3/8 jig and a 4in berkley ripple shad,fish were smaller on average than years past but still had a great time.Saw 4 moose total this trip.Here are some pics http://s26.photobucket.com/albums/c1...Canada%202011/ mostly just different parts of the lake but there is some fish porn and cabin shots....enjoy...Eric
Great stuff! Thanks for sharing. I love seeing the moose.
Great pictures.....wow the lake was really low! Thanks for sharing!
Thanks. Good way to get a Canada fix in the middle of January.

Nice pics. I have fished Lake St. Joe two times out of Camp St. Joe (eastern end of the lake). I am not familiar as to who you booked with and where root bay is. The cabin and lake look great. Randy from duluth
Here ya go randy....http://www.slatefallsoutposts.com/ using Google Earth look on the extreme west end of the lake..i have a pic there of the cabin...hope this helps
